intro: Galium myrianthum, commonly known as the many-flowered bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often covered in fine hairs. Galium myrianthum thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
